item.title: Why is the president still so beholden to Putin? I answered your questions.
item.description: David’s live chat with readers started at 12 p.m. ET on Monday. Read the transcript.

item.title: Let’s take a closer look at the sentencing of Kavanaugh’s would-be killer
item.description: Eight years for attempting to assassinate a Supreme Court justice? That’s incomprehensible.

item.title: I worked for Biden. Here’s the gold in Trump’s foreign policy.
item.description: The president leverages America’s power well and ignores domestic criticism.

item.title: These schools are the answer to unlocking every child’s potential
item.description: Children born into poverty should not be consigned to failing schools.

item.title: Trump keeps getting played by Putin. Will Budapest be different?
item.description: A Russia-Ukraine ceasefire might be possible if only Trump would apply more pressure on Putin.

item.title: Like the tea party of 2009, ‘No Kings’ protests are a warning to Trump
item.description: The GOP dismisses Saturday’s mass mobilization at its political peril.

item.title: The Gaza ceasefire is cracking. Hamas is to blame.
item.description: Terrorist brutality risks igniting a Palestinian civil war.

item.title: Put American bears first
item.description: Readers respond to recent Post articles and commentary.

item.title: The sweetheart deal is over for academia
item.description: Universities must rebuild public trust starting with viewpoint diversity.

item.title: Here’s what will really affect jobs in the age of AI
item.description: The true challenge is ensuring that workers have the skills to use the technology.

item.title: Bureaucracy holds back Los Angeles’s wildfire recovery
item.description: Politicians promised regulatory reform after the blazes but delivered administrative purgatory.

item.title: Why D.C. is stalling on self-driving cars
item.description: Safety is a phony excuse for slamming the brakes on autonomous vehicles.
